content: **this is a pay what you want pattern use the code hollyjolly50 for 50% off the original price or use the code hollyjolly100 for a free copy thank you for your support introducing the holly jolly earwarmer the perfect accessory to keep your ears toasty and stylish during the chilly months this cozy ear warmer features a beautiful textured waffle stitch that adds depth and dimension creating a chunky snug fit that s as warm as it is cute made with thick soft yarn the holly jolly earwarmer works up quickly making it an ideal project for last-minute gifts or a weekend crafting session whether you re braving the winter weather or adding a festive touch to your outfit this ear warmer is sure to become a seasonal favorite this pattern is made in super bulky weight yarn with a 8mm hook i recommend choosing a natural or synthetic fiber not something plant based as that won t be as warm this earwarmer is worked flat in the crochet waffle stitch using half_double_crochet you work it flat from bottom up and then seam the ends together this pattern is written for one size which should fit most adults and teens but you can easily adjust the fit to your preference by adding or subtracting row and/or changing the stitch multiple which is 3+1 this is worked in a modified waffle stitch for cleaner edges and a denser fabric there are measurements listed in the pattern this is a beginner friendly pattern it utilizes basic stitches and the stitch repeat is easy to memorize and work up it includes a photo tutorial at the end of the written instructions thank you for choosing my pattern i hope you enjoyed it you may sell as many of the finished items as you wish but if you share on social media please give me credit @stopitharry on ravelry and link the pattern to its source if you have any questions or need pattern support please contact me @stopitharry on ravelry i appreciate your support thank you to my amazing testers yarnseed /people/yarnseed divavonpurl /people/divavonpurl handmadecrafted /people/handmadecrafted and fatdogcrochet /people/fatdogcrochet this pattern wouldn t be possible without you
